00001 // S03 package to perform Wigner transform on the rotation group SO(3)
00002 // Copyright (C) 2013 Martin BÃ¼ttner and Jason McEwen
00003 // See LICENSE.txt for license details
00004 
00013 #include <stdio.h>
00014 #include <stdlib.h>
00015 #include <string.h>
00016 #include <math.h>
00017 #include <complex.h>  // Must be before fftw3.h
00018 #include <fftw3.h>
00019 
00020 #include "ssht.h"
00021 
00022 #include "so3_types.h"
00023 #include "so3_error.h"
00024 #include "so3_sampling.h"
00025 
00026 #define MIN(a,b) ((a < b) ? (a) : (b))
00027 #define MAX(a,b) ((a > b) ? (a) : (b))
00028 
00029 typedef void (*inverse_complex_ssht)(complex double *, const complex double *, int, int, int, ssht_dl_method_t, int);
00030 typedef void (*inverse_real_ssht)(double *, const complex double *, int, int, ssht_dl_method_t, int);
00031 typedef void (*forward_complex_ssht)(complex double *, const complex double *, int, int, int, ssht_dl_method_t, int);
00032 typedef void (*forward_real_ssht)(complex double *, const double *, int, int, ssht_dl_method_t, int);
00033 
00048 void so3_core_inverse_via_ssht(
00049     complex double *f, const complex double *flmn,
00050     const so3_parameters_t *parameters
00051 ) {
00052 
00053     int L0, L, N;
00054     so3_sampling_t sampling;
00055     so3_storage_t storage;
00056     so3_n_mode_t n_mode;
00057     ssht_dl_method_t dl_method;
00058     int steerable;
00059     int verbosity;
00060 
00061     // Iterator
00062     int n;
00063     // Intermediate results
00064     complex double *fn, *ftemp;
00065     // Stride for several arrays
00066     int fn_n_stride;
00067     // FFTW-related variables
00068     int fftw_rank, fftw_howmany;
00069     int fftw_idist, fftw_odist;
00070     int fftw_istride, fftw_ostride;
00071     int fftw_n;
00072     complex double *fftw_target;
00073     fftw_plan plan;
00074 
00075     inverse_complex_ssht ssht;
00076 
00077     L0 = parameters->L0;
00078     L = parameters->L;
00079     N = parameters->N;
00080     sampling = parameters->sampling_scheme;
00081     storage = parameters->storage;
00082     // TODO: Support N_MODE_L
00083     n_mode = parameters->n_mode;
00084     dl_method = parameters->dl_method;
00085     verbosity = parameters->verbosity;
00086     steerable = parameters->steerable;
00087 
00088     // Print messages depending on verbosity level.
00089     if (verbosity > 0) {
00090         printf("%sComputing inverse transform using MW sampling with\n", SO3_PROMPT);
00091         printf("%sparameters  (L, N, reality) = (%d, %d, FALSE)\n", SO3_PROMPT, L, N);
00092         if (verbosity > 1)
00093             printf("%sUsing routine so3_core_mw_inverse_via_ssht with storage method %d...\n"
00094                     , SO3_PROMPT
00095                     , storage);
00096     }
00097 
00098     switch (sampling)
00099     {
00100     case SO3_SAMPLING_MW:
00101         fn_n_stride = L * (2*L-1);
00102         ssht = ssht_core_mw_lb_inverse_sov_sym;
00103         break;
00104     case SO3_SAMPLING_MW_SS:
00105         fn_n_stride = (L+1) * 2*L;
00106         ssht = ssht_core_mw_lb_inverse_sov_sym_ss;
00107         break;
00108     default:
00109         SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid sampling scheme.");
00110     }
00111 
00112     // Compute fn(a,b)
00113 
00114     if (steerable)
00115     {
00116         // For steerable signals, we need to supersample in n/gamma,
00117         // in order to create a symmetric sampling.
00118         fftw_n = 2*N; // Each transform is over 2*N
00119 
00120         // We need to perform the FFT into a temporary buffer, because
00121         // the result will be twice as large as the output we need.
00122         ftemp = malloc(2*N*fn_n_stride * sizeof *ftemp);
00123         SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(ftemp);
00124 
00125         fftw_target = ftemp;
00126     }
00127     else
00128     {
00129         fftw_n = 2*N-1; // Each transform is over 2*N-1
00130 
00131         fftw_target = f;
00132     }
00133 
00134     fn = calloc(fftw_n*fn_n_stride, sizeof *fn);
00135     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(fn);
00136 
00137 
00138 
00139     // Initialize fftw_plan first. With FFTW_ESTIMATE this is technically not
00140     // necessary but still good practice.
00141     fftw_rank = 1; // We compute 1d transforms
00142     fftw_howmany = fn_n_stride; // We need L*(2*L-1) of these transforms
00143 
00144     // We want to transform columns
00145     fftw_idist = fftw_odist = 1; // The starts of the columns are contiguous in memory
00146     fftw_istride = fftw_ostride = fn_n_stride; // Distance between two elements of the same column
00147 
00148     plan = fftw_plan_many_dft(
00149             fftw_rank, &fftw_n, fftw_howmany,
00150             fn, NULL, fftw_istride, fftw_idist,
00151             fftw_target, NULL, fftw_ostride, fftw_odist,
00152             FFTW_BACKWARD, FFTW_ESTIMATE
00153     );
00154 
00155     for(n = -N+1; n <= N-1; ++n)
00156     {
00157         int ind, offset, i, el;
00158         int L0e = MAX(L0, abs(n)); // 'e' for 'effective'
00159         double factor;
00160         complex double *flm;
00161 
00162         if ((n_mode == SO3_N_MODE_EVEN && n % 2)
00163             || (n_mode == SO3_N_MODE_ODD && !(n % 2))
00164             || (n_mode == SO3_N_MODE_MAXIMUM && abs(n) < N-1)
00165         ) {
00166             continue;
00167         }
00168 
00169         flm = malloc(L*L * sizeof *flm);
00170         SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(flm);
00171 
00172         switch (storage)
00173         {
00174         case SO3_STORAGE_PADDED:
00175             so3_sampling_elmn2ind(&ind, 0, 0, n, parameters);
00176             memcpy(flm, flmn + ind, L*L * sizeof(complex double));
00177             break;
00178         case SO3_STORAGE_COMPACT:
00179             so3_sampling_elmn2ind(&ind, abs(n), -abs(n), n, parameters);
00180             memcpy(flm + n*n, flmn + ind, (L*L - n*n) * sizeof(complex double));
00181             for(i = 0; i < n*n; ++i)
00182                 flm[i] = 0.0;
00183             break;
00184         default:
00185             SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid storage method.");
00186         }
00187 
00188         el = L0e;
00189         i = offset = el*el;
00190         for(; el < L; ++el)
00191         {
00192             factor = sqrt((double)(2*el+1)/(16.*pow(SO3_PI, 3.)));
00193             for (; i < offset + 2*el+1; ++i)
00194                 flm[i] *= factor;
00195 
00196             offset = i;
00197         }
00198 
00199         // The conditional applies the spatial transform, so that we store
00200         // the results in n-order 0, 1, 2, -2, -1
00201         offset = (n < 0 ? n + fftw_n : n);
00202 
00203         (*ssht)(
00204             fn + offset*fn_n_stride, flm,
00205             L0e, L, -n,
00206             dl_method,
00207             verbosity
00208         );
00209 
00210         if(n % 2)
00211             for(i = 0; i < fn_n_stride; ++i)
00212                 fn[offset*fn_n_stride + i] = -fn[offset*fn_n_stride + i];
00213 
00214         if (verbosity > 0)
00215             printf("\n");
00216 
00217         free(flm);
00218     }
00219 
00220 
00221     fftw_execute(plan);
00222     fftw_destroy_plan(plan);
00223 
00224     if (steerable)
00225     {
00226         memcpy(f, ftemp, N*fn_n_stride * sizeof(complex double));
00227         free(ftemp);
00228     }
00229 
00230     free(fn);
00231 
00232     if (verbosity > 0)
00233         printf("%sInverse transform computed!\n", SO3_PROMPT);
00234 }
00235 
00236 
00253 void so3_core_forward_via_ssht(
00254     complex double *flmn, const complex double *f,
00255     const so3_parameters_t *parameters
00256 ) {
00257     int L0, L, N;
00258     so3_sampling_t sampling;
00259     so3_storage_t storage;
00260     so3_n_mode_t n_mode;
00261     ssht_dl_method_t dl_method;
00262     int steerable;
00263     int verbosity;
00264 
00265     // Iterator
00266     int i, n;
00267     // Intermediate results
00268     complex double *ftemp, *fn;
00269     // Stride for several arrays
00270     int fn_n_stride;
00271     // FFTW-related variables
00272     int fftw_rank, fftw_howmany;
00273     int fftw_idist, fftw_odist;
00274     int fftw_istride, fftw_ostride;
00275     int fftw_n;
00276     fftw_plan plan;
00277 
00278     forward_complex_ssht ssht;
00279 
00280     // for precomputation
00281     double factor;
00282 
00283     L0 = parameters->L0;
00284     L = parameters->L;
00285     N = parameters->N;
00286     sampling = parameters->sampling_scheme;
00287     storage = parameters->storage;
00288     // TODO: Support N_MODE_L
00289     n_mode = parameters->n_mode;
00290     dl_method = parameters->dl_method;
00291     verbosity = parameters->verbosity;
00292     steerable = parameters->steerable;
00293 
00294     // Print messages depending on verbosity level.
00295     if (verbosity > 0) {
00296         printf("%sComputing forward transform using MW sampling with\n", SO3_PROMPT);
00297         printf("%sparameters  (L, N, reality) = (%d, %d, FALSE)\n", SO3_PROMPT, L, N);
00298         if (verbosity > 1)
00299             printf("%sUsing routine so3_core_mw_forward_via_ssht with storage method %d...\n"
00300                     , SO3_PROMPT
00301                     , storage);
00302     }
00303 
00304     switch (sampling)
00305     {
00306     case SO3_SAMPLING_MW:
00307         fn_n_stride = L * (2*L-1);
00308         ssht = ssht_core_mw_lb_forward_sov_conv_sym;
00309         break;
00310     case SO3_SAMPLING_MW_SS:
00311         fn_n_stride = (L+1) * 2*L;
00312         ssht = ssht_core_mw_lb_forward_sov_conv_sym_ss;
00313         break;
00314     default:
00315         SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid sampling scheme.");
00316     }
00317 
00318     if (steerable)
00319     {
00320         int g, offset;
00321 
00322         fn = calloc((2*N-1)*fn_n_stride, sizeof *fn);
00323         SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(fn);
00324 
00325         for (n = -N+1; n < N; n+=2)
00326         {
00327             // The conditional applies the spatial transform, because the fn
00328             // are to be stored in n-order 0, 1, 2, -2, -1
00329             offset = (n < 0 ? n + 2*N-1 : n);
00330 
00331             for (g = 0; g < N; ++g)
00332             {
00333                 double gamma = g * SO3_PI / N;
00334                 for (i = 0; i < fn_n_stride; ++i)
00335                 {
00336                     double weight = 2*SO3_PI/N;
00337                     fn[offset * fn_n_stride + i] += weight*f[g * fn_n_stride + i]*cexp(-I*n*gamma);
00338                 }
00339             }
00340         }
00341     }
00342     else
00343     {
00344         // Make a copy of the input, because input is const
00345         // This could potentially be avoided by copying the input into fn and using an
00346         // in-place FFTW. The performance impact has to be profiled, though.
00347         ftemp = malloc((2*N-1)*fn_n_stride * sizeof *ftemp);
00348         SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(ftemp);
00349         memcpy(ftemp, f, (2*N-1)*fn_n_stride * sizeof(complex double));
00350 
00351         fn = malloc((2*N-1)*fn_n_stride * sizeof *fn);
00352         SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(fn);
00353 
00354         // Initialize fftw_plan first. With FFTW_ESTIMATE this is technically not
00355         // necessary but still good practice.
00356         fftw_rank = 1;
00357         fftw_n = 2*N-1;
00358         fftw_howmany = fn_n_stride;
00359         fftw_idist = fftw_odist = 1;
00360         fftw_istride = fftw_ostride = fn_n_stride;
00361 
00362         plan = fftw_plan_many_dft(
00363                 fftw_rank, &fftw_n, fftw_howmany,
00364                 ftemp, NULL, fftw_istride, fftw_idist,
00365                 fn, NULL, fftw_ostride, fftw_odist,
00366                 FFTW_FORWARD, FFTW_ESTIMATE
00367         );
00368 
00369         fftw_execute(plan);
00370         fftw_destroy_plan(plan);
00371 
00372         free(ftemp);
00373 
00374         factor = 2*SO3_PI/(double)(2*N-1);
00375         for(i = 0; i < (2*N-1)*fn_n_stride; ++i)
00376             fn[i] *= factor;
00377     }
00378 
00379     for(n = -N+1; n <= N-1; ++n)
00380     {
00381         int ind, offset, el, sign;
00382         int L0e = MAX(L0, abs(n)); // 'e' for 'effective'
00383 
00384         complex double *flm = NULL;
00385 
00386         if ((n_mode == SO3_N_MODE_EVEN && n % 2)
00387             || (n_mode == SO3_N_MODE_ODD && !(n % 2))
00388             || (n_mode == SO3_N_MODE_MAXIMUM && abs(n) < N-1)
00389         ) {
00390             continue;
00391         }
00392 
00393         if (storage == SO3_STORAGE_COMPACT)
00394             flm = malloc(L*L * sizeof *flm);
00395 
00396         // The conditional applies the spatial transform, because the fn
00397         // are stored in n-order 0, 1, 2, -2, -1
00398         offset = (n < 0 ? n + 2*N-1 : n);
00399 
00400         complex double *flm_block;
00401         complex double *fn_block = fn + offset*fn_n_stride;
00402 
00403         el = L0e;
00404         switch (storage)
00405         {
00406         case SO3_STORAGE_PADDED:
00407             so3_sampling_elmn2ind(&ind, 0, 0, n, parameters);
00408             flm_block = flmn + ind;
00409             i = offset = el*el;
00410             break;
00411         case SO3_STORAGE_COMPACT:
00412             flm_block = flm;
00413             i = offset = el*el-n*n;
00414             break;
00415         default:
00416             SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid storage method.");
00417         }
00418 
00419         (*ssht)(
00420             flm_block, fn_block,
00421             L0e, L, -n,
00422             dl_method,
00423             verbosity
00424         );
00425 
00426         if (storage == SO3_STORAGE_COMPACT)
00427         {
00428             so3_sampling_elmn2ind(&ind, abs(n), -abs(n), n, parameters);
00429             memcpy(flmn + ind, flm + n*n, (L*L - n*n) * sizeof(complex double));
00430         }
00431 
00432         if (n % 2)
00433             sign = -1;
00434         else
00435             sign = 1;
00436 
00437         for(; el < L; ++el)
00438         {
00439             factor = sign*sqrt(4.0*SO3_PI/(double)(2*el+1));
00440             for (; i < offset + 2*el+1; ++i)
00441                 flmn[ind + i] *= factor;
00442 
00443             offset = i;
00444         }
00445 
00446         if (storage == SO3_STORAGE_COMPACT)
00447             free(flm);
00448 
00449         if (verbosity > 0)
00450             printf("\n");
00451     }
00452 
00453     free(fn);
00454 
00455     if (verbosity > 0)
00456         printf("%sForward transform computed!\n", SO3_PROMPT);
00457 
00458 }
00459 
00475 void so3_core_inverse_via_ssht_real(
00476     double *f, const complex double *flmn,
00477     const so3_parameters_t *parameters
00478 ) {
00479     int L0, L, N;
00480     so3_sampling_t sampling;
00481     so3_storage_t storage;
00482     so3_n_mode_t n_mode;
00483     ssht_dl_method_t dl_method;
00484     int steerable;
00485     int verbosity;
00486 
00487     // Iterator
00488     int n;
00489     // Intermediate results
00490     complex double *fn, *flm;
00491     double *ftemp;
00492     // Stride for several arrays
00493     int fn_n_stride;
00494     // FFTW-related variables
00495     int fftw_rank, fftw_howmany;
00496     int fftw_idist, fftw_odist;
00497     int fftw_istride, fftw_ostride;
00498     int fftw_n;
00499     double *fftw_target;
00500     fftw_plan plan;
00501 
00502     inverse_complex_ssht complex_ssht;
00503     inverse_real_ssht real_ssht;
00504 
00505     L0 = parameters->L0;
00506     L = parameters->L;
00507     N = parameters->N;
00508     sampling = parameters->sampling_scheme;
00509     storage = parameters->storage;
00510     // TODO: Support N_MODE_L
00511     n_mode = parameters->n_mode;
00512     dl_method = parameters->dl_method;
00513     verbosity = parameters->verbosity;
00514     steerable = parameters->steerable;
00515 
00516     // Print messages depending on verbosity level.
00517     if (verbosity > 0) {
00518         printf("%sComputing inverse transform using MW sampling with\n", SO3_PROMPT);
00519         printf("%sparameters  (L, N, reality) = (%d, %d, FALSE)\n", SO3_PROMPT, L, N);
00520         if (verbosity > 1)
00521             printf("%sUsing routine so3_core_mw_inverse_via_ssht_real with storage method %d...\n"
00522                     , SO3_PROMPT
00523                     , storage);
00524     }
00525 
00526     switch (sampling)
00527     {
00528     case SO3_SAMPLING_MW:
00529         fn_n_stride = L * (2*L-1);
00530         complex_ssht = ssht_core_mw_lb_inverse_sov_sym;
00531         real_ssht = ssht_core_mw_lb_inverse_sov_sym_real;
00532         break;
00533     case SO3_SAMPLING_MW_SS:
00534         fn_n_stride = (L+1) * 2*L;
00535         complex_ssht = ssht_core_mw_lb_inverse_sov_sym_ss;
00536         real_ssht = ssht_core_mw_lb_inverse_sov_sym_ss_real;
00537         break;
00538     default:
00539         SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid sampling scheme.");
00540     }
00541 
00542     // Compute fn(a,b)
00543 
00544     // For steerable signals, we need to supersample in n/gamma,
00545     // in order to create a symmetric sampling.
00546     // Each transform is over fftw_n samples (logically; physically, fn for negative n will be omitted)
00547     if (steerable)
00548     {
00549         // For steerable signals, we need to supersample in n/gamma,
00550         // in order to create a symmetric sampling.
00551         fftw_n = 2*N;
00552 
00553         // We need to perform the FFT into a temporary buffer, because
00554         // the result will be twice as large as the output we need.
00555         ftemp = malloc(2*N*fn_n_stride * sizeof *ftemp);
00556         SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(ftemp);
00557 
00558         fftw_target = ftemp;
00559     }
00560     else
00561     {
00562         fftw_n = 2*N-1;
00563 
00564         fftw_target = f;
00565     }
00566 
00567     // Only need to store for non-negative n
00568     fn = calloc((fftw_n/2+1)*fn_n_stride, sizeof *fn);
00569     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(fn);
00570 
00571     // Initialize fftw_plan first. With FFTW_ESTIMATE this is technically not
00572     // necessary but still good practice.
00573     fftw_rank = 1; // We compute 1d transforms
00574     fftw_howmany = fn_n_stride; // We need L*(2*L-1) of these transforms
00575 
00576     // We want to transform columns
00577     fftw_idist = fftw_odist = 1; // The starts of the columns are contiguous in memory
00578     fftw_istride = fftw_ostride = fn_n_stride; // Distance between two elements of the same column
00579 
00580     plan = fftw_plan_many_dft_c2r(
00581             fftw_rank, &fftw_n, fftw_howmany,
00582             fn, NULL, fftw_istride, fftw_idist,
00583             fftw_target, NULL, fftw_ostride, fftw_odist,
00584             FFTW_ESTIMATE
00585     );
00586 
00587     flm = malloc(L*L * sizeof *flm);
00588     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(flm);
00589 
00590     for(n = 0; n <= N-1; ++n)
00591     {
00592         int ind, offset, i, el;
00593         int L0e = MAX(L0, abs(n)); // 'e' for 'effective'
00594         double factor;
00595 
00596         if ((n_mode == SO3_N_MODE_EVEN && n % 2)
00597             || (n_mode == SO3_N_MODE_ODD && !(n % 2))
00598             || (n_mode == SO3_N_MODE_MAXIMUM && abs(n) < N-1)
00599         ) {
00600             continue;
00601         }
00602 
00603         switch (storage)
00604         {
00605         case SO3_STORAGE_PADDED:
00606             so3_sampling_elmn2ind_real(&ind, 0, 0, n, parameters); //L, N, SO3_STORE_NEG_FIRST_PAD);
00607             memcpy(flm, flmn + ind, L*L * sizeof(complex double));
00608             break;
00609         case SO3_STORAGE_COMPACT:
00610             so3_sampling_elmn2ind_real(&ind, n, -n, n, parameters); //L, N, SO3_STORE_NEG_FIRST_COMPACT);
00611             memcpy(flm + n*n, flmn + ind, (L*L - n*n) * sizeof(complex double));
00612             for(i = 0; i < n*n; ++i)
00613                 flm[i] = 0.0;
00614             break;
00615         default:
00616             SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid storage method.");
00617         }
00618 
00619         el = L0e;
00620         i = offset = el*el;
00621         for(; el < L; ++el)
00622         {
00623             factor = sqrt((double)(2*el+1)/(16.*pow(SO3_PI, 3.)));
00624             for (; i < offset + 2*el+1; ++i)
00625                 flm[i] *= factor;
00626 
00627             offset = i;
00628         }
00629 
00630         if (N > 1 || n)
00631         {
00632             (*complex_ssht)(
00633                 fn + n*fn_n_stride, flm,
00634                 L0e, L, -n,
00635                 dl_method,
00636                 verbosity
00637             );
00638         }
00639         else
00640         {
00641             double *fn_r;
00642 
00643             // Create an array of real doubles for n = 0
00644             fn_r = calloc(fn_n_stride, sizeof *fn_r);
00645             SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(fn_r);
00646 
00647             (*real_ssht)(
00648                 fn_r, flm,
00649                 L0e, L,
00650                 dl_method,
00651                 verbosity
00652             );
00653 
00654             for (i = 0; i < fn_n_stride; ++i)
00655                 fn[i] = fn_r[i];
00656         }
00657 
00658 
00659         if(n % 2)
00660             for(i = 0; i < fn_n_stride; ++i)
00661                 fn[n*fn_n_stride + i] = -fn[n*fn_n_stride + i];
00662 
00663         if (verbosity > 0)
00664             printf("\n");
00665     }
00666 
00667     free(flm);
00668 
00669     fftw_execute(plan);
00670     fftw_destroy_plan(plan);
00671 
00672     if (steerable)
00673     {
00674         memcpy(f, ftemp, N*fn_n_stride * sizeof *f);
00675         free(ftemp);
00676     }
00677 
00678     free(fn);
00679 
00680     if (verbosity > 0)
00681         printf("%sInverse transform computed!\n", SO3_PROMPT);
00682 }
00683 
00700 void so3_core_forward_via_ssht_real(
00701     complex double *flmn, const double *f,
00702     const so3_parameters_t *parameters
00703 ) {
00704     int L0, L, N;
00705     so3_sampling_t sampling;
00706     so3_storage_t storage;
00707     so3_n_mode_t n_mode;
00708     ssht_dl_method_t dl_method;
00709     int steerable;
00710     int verbosity;
00711 
00712     // Iterator
00713     int i, n;
00714     // Intermediate results
00715     double *ftemp;
00716     complex double *flm = NULL, *fn;
00717     // Stride for several arrays
00718     int fn_n_stride;
00719     // FFTW-related variables
00720     int fftw_rank, fftw_howmany;
00721     int fftw_idist, fftw_odist;
00722     int fftw_istride, fftw_ostride;
00723     int fftw_n;
00724     fftw_plan plan;
00725 
00726     forward_complex_ssht complex_ssht;
00727     forward_real_ssht real_ssht;
00728 
00729     // for precomputation
00730     double factor;
00731 
00732     L0 = parameters->L0;
00733     L = parameters->L;
00734     N = parameters->N;
00735     sampling = parameters->sampling_scheme;
00736     storage = parameters->storage;
00737     // TODO: Support N_MODE_L
00738     n_mode = parameters->n_mode;
00739     dl_method = parameters->dl_method;
00740     steerable = parameters->steerable;
00741     verbosity = parameters->verbosity;
00742 
00743     // Print messages depending on verbosity level.
00744     if (verbosity > 0) {
00745         printf("%sComputing forward transform using MW sampling with\n", SO3_PROMPT);
00746         printf("%sparameters  (L, N, reality) = (%d, %d, FALSE)\n", SO3_PROMPT, L, N);
00747         if (verbosity > 1)
00748             printf("%sUsing routine so3_core_mw_forward_via_ssht_real with storage method %d...\n"
00749                     , SO3_PROMPT
00750                     , storage);
00751     }
00752 
00753     switch (sampling)
00754     {
00755     case SO3_SAMPLING_MW:
00756         fn_n_stride = L * (2*L-1);
00757         complex_ssht = ssht_core_mw_lb_forward_sov_conv_sym;
00758         real_ssht = ssht_core_mw_lb_forward_sov_conv_sym_real;
00759         break;
00760     case SO3_SAMPLING_MW_SS:
00761         fn_n_stride = (L+1) * 2*L;
00762         complex_ssht = ssht_core_mw_lb_forward_sov_conv_sym_ss;
00763         real_ssht = ssht_core_mw_lb_forward_sov_conv_sym_ss_real;
00764         break;
00765     default:
00766         SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid sampling scheme.");
00767     }
00768 
00769 
00770     if (steerable)
00771     {
00772         int g, offset;
00773 
00774         fn = calloc((2*N-1)*fn_n_stride, sizeof *fn);
00775         SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(fn);
00776 
00777         for (n = -N+1; n < N; n+=2)
00778         {
00779             // The conditional applies the spatial transform, because the fn
00780             // are to be stored in n-order 0, 1, 2, -2, -1
00781             offset = (n < 0 ? n + 2*N-1 : n);
00782 
00783             for (g = 0; g < N; ++g)
00784             {
00785                 double gamma = g * SO3_PI / N;
00786                 for (i = 0; i < fn_n_stride; ++i)
00787                 {
00788                     double weight = 2*SO3_PI/N;
00789                     fn[offset * fn_n_stride + i] += weight*f[g * fn_n_stride + i]*cexp(-I*n*gamma);
00790                 }
00791             }
00792         }
00793     }
00794     else
00795     {
00796         // Make a copy of the input, because input is const
00797         // This could potentially be avoided by copying the input into fn and using an
00798         // in-place FFTW. The performance impact has to be profiled, though.
00799         ftemp = malloc((2*N-1)*fn_n_stride * sizeof *ftemp);
00800         SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(ftemp);
00801         memcpy(ftemp, f, (2*N-1)*fn_n_stride * sizeof(double));
00802 
00803         fn = malloc(N*fn_n_stride * sizeof *fn);
00804         SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(fn);
00805         // Initialize fftw_plan first. With FFTW_ESTIMATE this is technically not
00806         // necessary but still good practice.
00807         fftw_rank = 1; // We compute 1d transforms
00808         fftw_n = 2*N-1; // Each transform is over 2*N-1 (logically; physically, fn for negative n will be omitted)
00809         fftw_howmany = fn_n_stride; // We need L*(2*L-1) of these transforms
00810 
00811         // We want to transform columns
00812         fftw_idist = fftw_odist = 1; // The starts of the columns are contiguous in memory
00813         fftw_istride = fftw_ostride = fn_n_stride; // Distance between two elements of the same column
00814 
00815         plan = fftw_plan_many_dft_r2c(
00816                 fftw_rank, &fftw_n, fftw_howmany,
00817                 ftemp, NULL, fftw_istride, fftw_idist,
00818                 fn, NULL, fftw_ostride, fftw_odist,
00819                 FFTW_ESTIMATE
00820         );
00821 
00822         fftw_execute(plan);
00823         fftw_destroy_plan(plan);
00824 
00825         free(ftemp);
00826 
00827         factor = 2*SO3_PI/(double)(2*N-1);
00828         for(i = 0; i < N*fn_n_stride; ++i)
00829             fn[i] *= factor;
00830     }
00831 
00832     if (storage == SO3_STORAGE_COMPACT)
00833         flm = malloc(L*L * sizeof *flm);
00834 
00835     for(n = 0; n <= N-1; ++n)
00836     {
00837         int ind, offset, el, sign;
00838         int L0e = MAX(L0, abs(n)); // 'e' for 'effective'
00839 
00840         complex double* flm_block;
00841 
00842         if ((n_mode == SO3_N_MODE_EVEN && n % 2)
00843             || (n_mode == SO3_N_MODE_ODD && !(n % 2))
00844             || (n_mode == SO3_N_MODE_MAXIMUM && abs(n) < N-1)
00845         ) {
00846             continue;
00847         }
00848 
00849         el = L0e;
00850         i = offset = el*el;
00851         switch (storage)
00852         {
00853         case SO3_STORAGE_PADDED:
00854             so3_sampling_elmn2ind_real(&ind, 0, 0, n, parameters);
00855             flm_block = flmn + ind;
00856             break;
00857         case SO3_STORAGE_COMPACT:
00858             flm_block = flm;
00859 
00860             offset -= n*n;
00861             i = offset;
00862             break;
00863         default:
00864             SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid storage method.");
00865         }
00866 
00867 
00868         if (N > 1)
00869         {
00870             (*complex_ssht)(
00871                 flm_block, fn + n*fn_n_stride,
00872                 L0e, L, -n,
00873                 dl_method,
00874                 verbosity
00875             );
00876         }
00877         else
00878         {
00879             // Now we know n = 0 in which case the reality conditions
00880             // for SO3 and SSHT coincide.
00881             int j;
00882             double *fn_r;
00883 
00884             // Create an array of real doubles for n = 0
00885             fn_r = malloc(fn_n_stride * sizeof *fn_r);
00886             SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(fn_r);
00887             for (j = 0; j < fn_n_stride; ++j)
00888                 fn_r[j] = creal(fn[j]);
00889 
00890             // Now use real SSHT transforms
00891             (*real_ssht)(
00892                 flm_block, fn_r,
00893                 L0e, L,
00894                 dl_method,
00895                 verbosity
00896             );
00897 
00898             free(fn_r);
00899         }
00900 
00901         if (storage == SO3_STORAGE_COMPACT)
00902         {
00903             so3_sampling_elmn2ind_real(&ind, n, -n, n, parameters);
00904             memcpy(flmn + ind, flm + n*n, (L*L - n*n) * sizeof(complex double));
00905         }
00906 
00907         if (n % 2)
00908             sign = -1;
00909         else
00910             sign = 1;
00911 
00912         for(; el < L; ++el)
00913         {
00914             factor = sign*sqrt(4.0*SO3_PI/(double)(2*el+1));
00915             for (; i < offset + 2*el+1; ++i)
00916                 flmn[ind + i] *= factor;
00917 
00918             offset = i;
00919         }
00920 
00921         if (verbosity > 0)
00922             printf("\n");
00923     }
00924 
00925     if (storage == SO3_STORAGE_COMPACT)
00926         free(flm);
00927 
00928     free(fn);
00929 
00930     if (verbosity > 0)
00931         printf("%sForward transform computed!\n", SO3_PROMPT);
00932 
00933 }
00934 
00935 
00951 void so3_core_inverse_direct(
00952     complex double *f, const complex double *flmn,
00953     const so3_parameters_t *parameters
00954 ) {
00955 
00956     int L0, L, N;
00957     so3_sampling_t sampling;
00958     so3_storage_t storage;
00959     so3_n_mode_t n_mode;
00960     ssht_dl_method_t dl_method;
00961     int steerable;
00962     int verbosity;
00963 
00964     L0 = parameters->L0;
00965     L = parameters->L;
00966     N = parameters->N;
00967     sampling = parameters->sampling_scheme;
00968     storage = parameters->storage;
00969     // TODO: Add optimisations for all n-modes.
00970     n_mode = parameters->n_mode;
00971     dl_method = parameters->dl_method;
00972     verbosity = parameters->verbosity;
00973     steerable = parameters->steerable;
00974 
00975     // Print messages depending on verbosity level.
00976     if (verbosity > 0)
00977     {
00978         printf("%sComputing inverse transform using MW sampling with\n", SO3_PROMPT);
00979         printf("%sparameters  (L, N, reality) = (%d, %d, FALSE)\n", SO3_PROMPT, L, N);
00980         if (verbosity > 1)
00981             printf("%sUsing routine so3_core_mw_inverse_direct with storage method %d...\n"
00982                     , SO3_PROMPT
00983                     , storage);
00984     }
00985 
00986     // Iterators
00987     int el, m, n, mm; // mm for m'
00988 
00989     // Allocate memory.
00990     double *sqrt_tbl = calloc(2*(L-1)+2, sizeof(*sqrt_tbl));
00991     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(sqrt_tbl);
00992     double *signs = calloc(L+1, sizeof(*signs));
00993     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(signs);
00994     complex double *exps = calloc(4, sizeof(*exps));
00995     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(exps);
00996   
00997     // Perform precomputations.
00998     for (el = 0; el <= 2*L-1; ++el)
00999         sqrt_tbl[el] = sqrt((double)el);
01000     for (m = 0; m <= L-1; m += 2)
01001     {
01002         signs[m]   =  1.0;
01003         signs[m+1] = -1.0;
01004     }
01005     int i;
01006     for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i)
01007         exps[i] = cexp(I*SO3_PION2*i);
01008 
01009     // Compute Fmnm'
01010     // TODO: Currently m is fastest-varying, then n, then m'.
01011     // Should this order be changed to m-m'-n?
01012     complex double *Fmnm = calloc((2*L-1)*(2*L-1)*(2*N-1), sizeof(*Fmnm));
01013     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(Fmnm);
01014     int m_offset = L-1;
01015     int m_stride = 2*L-1;
01016     int n_offset = N-1;
01017     int n_stride = 2*N-1;
01018     int mm_offset = L-1;
01019     int mm_stride = 2*L-1;
01020 
01021     int n_start, n_stop, n_inc;
01022 
01023     double *dl = ssht_dl_calloc(L, SSHT_DL_QUARTER);
01024     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(dl);
01025     double *dl8 = NULL;
01026     if (dl_method == SSHT_DL_RISBO)
01027     {
01028         dl8 = ssht_dl_calloc(L, SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED);
01029         SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(dl8);
01030     }
01031     int dl_offset = ssht_dl_get_offset(L, SSHT_DL_QUARTER);
01032     int dl_stride = ssht_dl_get_stride(L, SSHT_DL_QUARTER);
01033 
01034     complex double *mn_factors = calloc((2*L-1)*(2*N-1), sizeof *mn_factors);
01035     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(mn_factors);
01036 
01037     // TODO: SSHT starts this loop from MAX(L0, abs(spin)).
01038     // Can we use a similar optimisation? el can probably
01039     // be limited by n, but then we'd need to switch the
01040     // loop order, which means we'd have to recompute the
01041     // Wigner plane for each n. That seems wrong?
01042     for (el = L0; el <= L-1; ++el)
01043     {
01044         int eltmp;
01045         // Compute Wigner plane.
01046         switch (dl_method)
01047         {
01048         case SSHT_DL_RISBO:
01049             if (el != 0 && el == L0) 
01050             {
01051                 for(eltmp = 0; eltmp <= L0; ++eltmp)
01052                     ssht_dl_beta_risbo_eighth_table(
01053                             dl8, 
01054                             SO3_PION2, 
01055                             L,
01056                             SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED,
01057                             eltmp, 
01058                             sqrt_tbl, 
01059                             signs);
01060                 ssht_dl_beta_risbo_fill_eighth2quarter_table(dl,
01061                         dl8, L,
01062                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01063                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED,
01064                         el,
01065                         signs);
01066             } 
01067             else 
01068             {
01069                 ssht_dl_beta_risbo_eighth_table(
01070                         dl8, 
01071                         SO3_PION2, 
01072                         L,
01073                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED,
01074                         el, 
01075                         sqrt_tbl, 
01076                         signs);
01077                 ssht_dl_beta_risbo_fill_eighth2quarter_table(
01078                         dl,
01079                         dl8, L,
01080                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01081                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED,
01082                         el,
01083                         signs);
01084             }
01085             break;
01086 
01087         case SSHT_DL_TRAPANI:
01088             if (el != 0 && el == L0) 
01089             {
01090                 for(eltmp = 0; eltmp <= L0; ++eltmp)
01091                     ssht_dl_halfpi_trapani_eighth_table(
01092                             dl, 
01093                             L,
01094                             SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01095                             eltmp, 
01096                             sqrt_tbl);
01097                 ssht_dl_halfpi_trapani_fill_eighth2quarter_table(
01098                         dl, 
01099                         L,
01100                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01101                         el, 
01102                         signs);
01103             }
01104             else
01105             {
01106                 ssht_dl_halfpi_trapani_eighth_table(
01107                         dl, 
01108                         L,
01109                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01110                         el, 
01111                         sqrt_tbl);
01112                 ssht_dl_halfpi_trapani_fill_eighth2quarter_table(
01113                         dl, 
01114                         L,
01115                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01116                         el, 
01117                         signs);
01118             }
01119             break;
01120 
01121         default:
01122             SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid dl method");
01123         }
01124 
01125         // Compute Fmnm' contribution for current el.
01126 
01127         // Factor which depends only on el.
01128         double elfactor = (2.0*el+1.0)/(8.0*SO3_PI*SO3_PI);
01129 
01130         switch (n_mode)
01131         {
01132         case SO3_N_MODE_ALL:
01133             n_start = MAX(-N+1,-el);
01134             n_stop  = MIN( N-1, el);
01135             n_inc = 1;
01136             break;
01137         case SO3_N_MODE_EVEN:
01138             n_start = MAX(-N+1,-el);
01139             n_start += (-n_start)%2;
01140             n_stop  = MIN( N-1, el);
01141             n_stop  -=  n_stop%2;
01142             n_inc = 2;
01143             break;
01144         case SO3_N_MODE_ODD:
01145             n_start = MAX(-N+1,-el);
01146             n_start += 1+n_start%2;
01147             n_stop  = MIN( N-1, el);
01148             n_stop  -= 1-n_stop%2;
01149             n_inc = 2;
01150             break;
01151         case SO3_N_MODE_MAXIMUM:
01152             if (el < N-1)
01153                 continue;
01154             n_start = -N+1;
01155             n_stop  =  N-1;
01156             n_inc = MAX(1,2*N-2);
01157             break;
01158         case SO3_N_MODE_L:
01159             if (el >= N)
01160                 continue;
01161             n_start = -el;
01162             n_stop  =  el;
01163             n_inc = MAX(1,2*el);
01164             break;
01165         default:
01166             SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid n-mode.");
01167         }
01168 
01169         // Factors which do not depend on m'.
01170         for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
01171             for (m = -el; m <= el; ++m)
01172             {
01173                 int ind;
01174                 so3_sampling_elmn2ind(&ind, el, m, n, parameters);
01175                 int mod = ((n-m)%4 + 4)%4;
01176                 mn_factors[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01177                            n + n_offset)] =
01178                     flmn[ind] * exps[mod];
01179             }
01180 
01181         for (mm = 0; mm <= el; ++mm)
01182         {
01183             // These signs are needed for the symmetry relations of
01184             // Wigner symbols.
01185             double elmmsign = signs[el] * signs[mm];
01186 
01187             // TODO: If the conditional for elnsign is a bottleneck
01188             // this loop can be split up just like the inner loop.
01189             for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
01190             {
01191                 double elnsign = n >= 0 ? 1.0 : elmmsign;
01192                 // Factor which does not depend on m.
01193                 double elnmm_factor = elfactor * elnsign
01194                                       * dl[abs(n) + dl_offset + mm*dl_stride];
01195                 for (m = -el; m < 0; ++m)
01196                     Fmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01197                          n + n_offset + n_stride*(
01198                          mm + mm_offset))] +=
01199                         elnmm_factor 
01200                         * mn_factors[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01201                                      n + n_offset)]
01202                         * elmmsign * dl[-m + dl_offset + mm*dl_stride];
01203                 for (m = 0; m <= el; ++m)
01204                     Fmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01205                          n + n_offset + n_stride*(
01206                          mm + mm_offset))] +=
01207                         elnmm_factor 
01208                         * mn_factors[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01209                                      n + n_offset)]
01210                         * dl[m + dl_offset + mm*dl_stride];
01211             }
01212         }
01213     }
01214 
01215     // Free dl memory.
01216     free(dl);
01217     if (dl_method == SSHT_DL_RISBO)
01218         free(dl8);
01219 
01220     switch (n_mode)
01221     {
01222     case SO3_N_MODE_ALL:
01223     case SO3_N_MODE_L:
01224         n_start = -N+1;
01225         n_stop  =  N-1;
01226         n_inc = 1;
01227         break;
01228     case SO3_N_MODE_EVEN:
01229         n_start = ((N-1) % 2 == 0) ? -N+1 : -N+2;
01230         n_stop  = ((N-1) % 2 == 0) ?  N-1 :  N-2;
01231         n_inc = 2;
01232         break;
01233     case SO3_N_MODE_ODD:
01234         n_start = ((N-1) % 2 != 0) ? -N+1 : -N+2;
01235         n_stop  = ((N-1) % 2 != 0) ?  N-1 :  N-2;
01236         n_inc = 2;
01237         break;
01238     case SO3_N_MODE_MAXIMUM:
01239         n_start = -N+1;
01240         n_stop  =  N-1;
01241         n_inc = MAX(1,2*N - 2);
01242         break;
01243     default:
01244         SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid n-mode.");
01245     }
01246 
01247     // Use symmetry to compute Fmnm' for negative m'.
01248     for (mm = -L+1; mm < 0; ++mm)
01249         for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
01250             for (m = -L+1; m <= L-1; ++m)
01251                 Fmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01252                      n + n_offset + n_stride*(
01253                      mm + mm_offset))] =
01254                     signs[abs(m+n)%2]
01255                     * Fmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01256                            n + n_offset + n_stride*(
01257                            -mm + mm_offset))];
01258 
01259     // Apply phase modulation to account for sampling offset.
01260     for (mm = -L+1; mm <= L-1; ++mm)
01261     {
01262         complex double mmfactor = cexp(I*mm*SO3_PI/(2.0*L-1.0));
01263         for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
01264             for (m = -L+1; m <= L-1; ++m)
01265                 Fmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01266                      n + n_offset + n_stride*(
01267                      mm + mm_offset))] *= mmfactor;
01268     }
01269 
01270     // Allocate space for function values.
01271     complex double *fext = calloc((2*L-1)*(2*L-1)*(2*N-1), sizeof(*fext));
01272     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(fext);
01273 
01274 
01275     // Set up plan before initialising array.
01276     fftw_plan plan = fftw_plan_dft_3d(
01277                         2*N-1, 2*L-1, 2*L-1, 
01278                         fext, fext,
01279                         FFTW_BACKWARD, 
01280                         FFTW_ESTIMATE);
01281 
01282     // Apply spatial shift.
01283     for (mm = -L+1; mm <= L-1; ++mm)
01284     {
01285         int mm_shift = mm < 0 ? 2*L-1 : 0;
01286         for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
01287         {
01288             int n_shift = n < 0 ? 2*N-1 : 0;
01289             for (m = -L+1; m <= L-1; ++m)
01290             {
01291                 int m_shift = m < 0 ? 2*L-1 : 0;
01292                 fext[m + m_shift + m_stride*(
01293                      mm + mm_shift + mm_stride*(
01294                      n + n_shift))] =
01295                     Fmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01296                          n + n_offset + n_stride*(
01297                          mm + mm_offset))];
01298             }
01299         }
01300     }
01301 
01302     // Free Fmnm' memory.
01303     free(Fmnm);
01304 
01305     // Perform 3D FFT.
01306     fftw_execute(plan);
01307     fftw_destroy_plan(plan);
01308 
01309     // Extract f from the extended torus.
01310     int a,b,g;
01311     int a_stride = 2*L-1;
01312     int b_ext_stride = 2*L-1;
01313     int b_stride = L;
01314     for (g = 0; g < 2*N-1; ++g)
01315         for (b = 0; b < L; ++b)
01316             for (a = 0; a < 2*L-1; ++a)
01317                 f[a + a_stride*(
01318                   b + b_stride*(
01319                   g))] = fext[a + a_stride*(
01320                               b + b_ext_stride*(
01321                               g))];
01322 
01323     // Free fext memory.
01324     free(fext);
01325 
01326     if (verbosity > 0)
01327         printf("%sInverse transform computed!\n", SO3_PROMPT);
01328 
01329     // Free precomputation memory.
01330     free(sqrt_tbl);
01331     free(signs);
01332     free(exps);
01333     free(mn_factors);
01334 }
01335 
01336 
01354 void so3_core_forward_direct(
01355     complex double *flmn, const complex double *f,
01356     const so3_parameters_t *parameters
01357 ) {
01358     int L0, L, N;
01359     so3_sampling_t sampling;
01360     so3_storage_t storage;
01361     so3_n_mode_t n_mode;
01362     ssht_dl_method_t dl_method;
01363     int steerable;
01364     int verbosity;
01365 
01366     L0 = parameters->L0;
01367     L = parameters->L;
01368     N = parameters->N;
01369     sampling = parameters->sampling_scheme;
01370     storage = parameters->storage;
01371     // TODO: Add optimisations for all n-modes.
01372     n_mode = parameters->n_mode;
01373     dl_method = parameters->dl_method;
01374     verbosity = parameters->verbosity;
01375     steerable = parameters->steerable;
01376 
01377     // Print messages depending on verbosity level.
01378     if (verbosity > 0) {
01379         printf("%sComputing forward transform using MW sampling with\n", SO3_PROMPT);
01380         printf("%sparameters  (L, N, reality) = (%d, %d, FALSE)\n", SO3_PROMPT, L, N);
01381         if (verbosity > 1)
01382             printf("%sUsing routine so3_core_mw_forward_direct with storage method %d...\n"
01383                     , SO3_PROMPT
01384                     , storage);
01385     }
01386 
01387     int m_stride = 2*L-1;
01388     int m_offset = L-1;
01389     // unused: int n_stride = 2*N-1;
01390     int n_offset = N-1;
01391     int mm_stride = 2*L-1;
01392     int mm_offset = L-1;
01393     int a_stride = 2*L-1;
01394     int b_stride = L;
01395     int bext_stride = 2*L-1;
01396     // unused: int g_stride = 2*N-1;
01397 
01398     int n_start, n_stop, n_inc;
01399 
01400     switch (n_mode)
01401     {
01402     case SO3_N_MODE_ALL:
01403     case SO3_N_MODE_L:
01404         n_start = -N+1;
01405         n_stop  =  N-1;
01406         n_inc = 1;
01407         break;
01408     case SO3_N_MODE_EVEN:
01409         n_start = ((N-1) % 2 == 0) ? -N+1 : -N+2;
01410         n_stop  = ((N-1) % 2 == 0) ?  N-1 :  N-2;
01411         n_inc = 2;
01412         break;
01413     case SO3_N_MODE_ODD:
01414         n_start = ((N-1) % 2 != 0) ? -N+1 : -N+2;
01415         n_stop  = ((N-1) % 2 != 0) ?  N-1 :  N-2;
01416         n_inc = 2;
01417         break;
01418     case SO3_N_MODE_MAXIMUM:
01419         n_start = -N+1;
01420         n_stop  =  N-1;
01421         n_inc = MAX(1,2*N - 2);
01422         break;
01423     default:
01424         SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid n-mode.");
01425     }
01426 
01427     double *sqrt_tbl = calloc(2*(L-1)+2, sizeof(*sqrt_tbl));
01428     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(sqrt_tbl);
01429     double *signs = calloc(L+1, sizeof(*signs));
01430     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(signs);
01431     complex double *exps = calloc(2*L-1, sizeof(*exps));
01432     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(exps);
01433     complex double *expsmm = calloc(2*L-1, sizeof(*expsmm));
01434     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(expsmm);
01435 
01436     int el, m, n, mm; // mm is for m'
01437     // Perform precomputations.
01438     for (el = 0; el <= 2*(L-1)+1; ++el)
01439         sqrt_tbl[el] = sqrt((double)el);
01440     for (m = 0; m <= L-1; m += 2)
01441     {
01442         signs[m]   =  1.0;
01443         signs[m+1] = -1.0;
01444     }
01445     int i;
01446     for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i)
01447         exps[i] = cexp(I*SO3_PION2*i);
01448     for (mm = -L+1; mm <= L-1; ++mm)
01449         expsmm[mm + mm_offset] = cexp(-I*mm*SSHT_PI/(2.0*L-1.0));
01450 
01451     double norm_factor = 1.0/(2.0*L-1.0)/(2.0*N-1.0);
01452 
01453     // Compute Fourier transform over alpha and gamma, i.e. compute Fmn(b).
01454     complex double *Fmnb = calloc((2*L-1)*(2*L-1)*(2*N-1), sizeof(*Fmnb));
01455     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(Fmnb);
01456     complex double *inout = calloc((2*L-1)*(2*N-1), sizeof(*inout));
01457     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(inout);
01458     fftw_plan plan = fftw_plan_dft_2d(
01459                         2*N-1, 2*L-1,
01460                         inout, inout, 
01461                         FFTW_FORWARD, 
01462                         FFTW_ESTIMATE);
01463 
01464     int b, g;
01465     for (b = 0; b < L; ++b)
01466     {
01467         // TODO: This memcpy loop could probably be avoided by using
01468         // a more elaborate FFTW plan which performs the FFT directly
01469         // over the 1st and 3rd dimensions of f.
01470         for (g = 0; g < 2*N-1; ++g)
01471             memcpy(
01472                 inout + g*a_stride, 
01473                 f + 0 + a_stride*(
01474                     b + b_stride*(
01475                     g)), 
01476                 a_stride*sizeof(*f));
01477         fftw_execute_dft(plan, inout, inout);
01478 
01479         // Apply spatial shift and normalisation factor
01480         for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
01481         {
01482             int n_shift = n < 0 ? 2*N-1 : 0;
01483             for (m = -L+1; m <= L-1; ++m)
01484             {
01485                 int m_shift = m < 0 ? 2*L-1 : 0;
01486                 Fmnb[b + bext_stride*(
01487                      m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01488                      n + n_offset))] =
01489                     inout[m + m_shift + m_stride*(
01490                           n + n_shift)] * norm_factor;
01491             }
01492         }
01493     }
01494     fftw_destroy_plan(plan);
01495 
01496     // Extend Fmnb periodically.
01497     for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
01498         for (m = -L+1; m <= L-1; ++m)
01499         {
01500             int signmn = signs[abs(m+n)%2];
01501             for (b = L; b < 2*L-1; ++b)
01502                 Fmnb[b + bext_stride*(
01503                      m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01504                      n + n_offset))] =
01505                     signmn
01506                     * Fmnb[(2*L-2-b) + bext_stride*(
01507                            m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01508                            n + n_offset))];
01509         }
01510 
01511 
01512     // Compute Fourier transform over beta, i.e. compute Fmnm'.
01513     complex double *Fmnm = calloc((2*L-1)*(2*L-1)*(2*N-1), sizeof(*Fmnm));
01514     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(Fmnm);
01515 
01516     plan = fftw_plan_dft_1d(
01517             2*L-1,
01518             inout, inout, 
01519             FFTW_FORWARD, 
01520             FFTW_ESTIMATE);
01521     for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
01522         for (m = -L+1; m <= L-1; ++m)
01523         {
01524             memcpy(inout, 
01525                    Fmnb + 0 + bext_stride*(
01526                           m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01527                           n + n_offset)), 
01528                    bext_stride*sizeof(*Fmnb));
01529             fftw_execute_dft(plan, inout, inout);
01530 
01531             // Apply spatial shift and normalisation factor
01532             for (mm = -L+1; mm <= L-1; ++mm)
01533             {
01534                 int mm_shift = mm < 0 ? 2*L-1 : 0;
01535                 Fmnm[mm + mm_offset + mm_stride*(
01536                      m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01537                      n + n_offset))] =
01538                     inout[mm + mm_shift] / (2.0*L-1.0);
01539             }
01540         }
01541     fftw_destroy_plan(plan);
01542     free(inout);
01543 
01544     // Apply phase modulation to account for sampling offset.
01545     for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
01546         for (m = -L+1; m <= L-1; ++m)
01547             for (mm = -L+1; mm <= L-1; ++mm)
01548                 Fmnm[mm + mm_offset + mm_stride*(
01549                      m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01550                      n + n_offset))] *=
01551                     expsmm[mm + mm_offset];
01552 
01553     // Compute weights.
01554     complex double *w = calloc(4*L-3, sizeof(*w));
01555     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(w);
01556     int w_offset = 2*(L-1);
01557     for (mm = -2*(L-1); mm <= 2*(L-1); ++mm)
01558         w[mm+w_offset] = so3_sampling_weight(parameters, mm);
01559 
01560     // Compute IFFT of w to give wr.
01561     complex double *wr = calloc(4*L-3, sizeof(*w));
01562     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(wr);
01563     inout = calloc(4*L-3, sizeof(*inout));
01564     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(inout);
01565     fftw_plan plan_bwd = fftw_plan_dft_1d(
01566                             4*L-3, 
01567                             inout, inout, 
01568                             FFTW_BACKWARD, 
01569                             FFTW_MEASURE);
01570     fftw_plan plan_fwd = fftw_plan_dft_1d(
01571                             4*L-3, 
01572                             inout, 
01573                             inout, 
01574                             FFTW_FORWARD, 
01575                             FFTW_MEASURE);
01576 
01577     // Apply spatial shift.
01578     for (mm = 1; mm <= 2*L-2; ++mm)
01579         inout[mm + w_offset] = w[mm - 2*(L-1) - 1 + w_offset];
01580     for (mm = -2*(L-1); mm <= 0; ++mm)
01581         inout[mm + w_offset] = w[mm + 2*(L-1) + w_offset];
01582 
01583     fftw_execute_dft(plan_bwd, inout, inout);
01584 
01585     // Apply spatial shift.
01586     for (mm = 0; mm <= 2*L-2; ++mm)
01587         wr[mm + w_offset] = inout[mm - 2*(L-1) + w_offset];
01588     for (mm = -2*(L-1); mm <= -1; ++mm)
01589         wr[mm + w_offset] = inout[mm + 2*(L-1) + 1 + w_offset];
01590 
01591     // Compute Gmnm' by convolution implemented as product in real space.
01592     complex double *Fmnm_pad = calloc(4*L-3, sizeof(*Fmnm_pad));
01593     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(Fmnm_pad);
01594     complex double *Gmnm = calloc((2*L-1)*(2*L-1)*(2*N-1), sizeof(*Gmnm));
01595     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(Gmnm);
01596     for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
01597         for (m = -L+1; m <= L-1; ++m)
01598         {
01599 
01600             // Zero-pad Fmnm'.
01601             for (mm = -2*(L-1); mm <= -L; ++mm)
01602                 Fmnm_pad[mm+w_offset] = 0.0;
01603             for (mm = L; mm <= 2*(L-1); ++mm)
01604                 Fmnm_pad[mm+w_offset] = 0.0;
01605             for (mm = -(L-1); mm <= L-1; ++mm)
01606                 Fmnm_pad[mm + w_offset] =
01607                     Fmnm[mm + mm_offset + mm_stride*(
01608                          m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01609                          n + n_offset))];
01610         
01611             // Apply spatial shift.
01612             for (mm = 1; mm <= 2*L-2; ++mm)
01613                 inout[mm + w_offset] = Fmnm_pad[mm - 2*(L-1) - 1 + w_offset];
01614             for (mm = -2*(L-1); mm <= 0; ++mm)
01615                 inout[mm + w_offset] = Fmnm_pad[mm + 2*(L-1) + w_offset];
01616             // Compute IFFT of Fmnm'.
01617             fftw_execute_dft(plan_bwd, inout, inout);
01618             // Apply spatial shift.
01619             for (mm = 0; mm <= 2*L-2; ++mm)
01620                 Fmnm_pad[mm + w_offset] = inout[mm - 2*(L-1) + w_offset];
01621             for (mm = -2*(L-1); mm <= -1; ++mm)
01622                 Fmnm_pad[mm + w_offset] = inout[mm + 2*(L-1) + 1 + w_offset];
01623         
01624             // Compute product of Fmnm' and weight in real space.
01625             int r;
01626             for (r = -2*(L-1); r <= 2*(L-1); ++r)
01627                 Fmnm_pad[r + w_offset] *= wr[r + w_offset];
01628         
01629             // Apply spatial shift.
01630             for (mm = 1; mm <= 2*L-2; ++mm)
01631                 inout[mm + w_offset] = Fmnm_pad[mm - 2*(L-1) - 1 + w_offset];
01632             for (mm = -2*(L-1); mm <= 0; ++mm)
01633                 inout[mm + w_offset] = Fmnm_pad[mm + 2*(L-1) + w_offset];
01634             // Compute Gmnm' by FFT.
01635             fftw_execute_dft(plan_fwd, inout, inout);
01636             // Apply spatial shift.
01637             for (mm = 0; mm <= 2*L-2; ++mm)
01638                 Fmnm_pad[mm + w_offset] = inout[mm - 2*(L-1) + w_offset];
01639             for (mm = -2*(L-1); mm <= -1; ++mm)
01640                 Fmnm_pad[mm + w_offset] = inout[mm + 2*(L-1) + 1 + w_offset];
01641         
01642             // Extract section of Gmnm' of interest.
01643             for (mm = -(L-1); mm <= L-1; ++mm)
01644                 Gmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01645                      mm + mm_offset + mm_stride*(
01646                      n + n_offset))] =
01647                     Fmnm_pad[mm + w_offset] 
01648                     * 4.0 * SSHT_PI * SSHT_PI / (4.0*L-3.0);
01649         
01650         }
01651     fftw_destroy_plan(plan_bwd);
01652     fftw_destroy_plan(plan_fwd);
01653 
01654     // Compute flmn.
01655     double *dl, *dl8 = NULL;
01656     dl = ssht_dl_calloc(L, SSHT_DL_QUARTER);
01657     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(dl);
01658     if (dl_method == SSHT_DL_RISBO)
01659     {
01660         dl8 = ssht_dl_calloc(L, SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED);
01661         SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(dl8);
01662     }
01663     int dl_offset = ssht_dl_get_offset(L, SSHT_DL_QUARTER);
01664     int dl_stride = ssht_dl_get_stride(L, SSHT_DL_QUARTER);
01665     for (n = -N+1; n <= N-1; ++n)
01666         for (el = abs(n); el < L; ++el)
01667             for (m = -el; m <= el; ++m)
01668             {
01669                 int ind;
01670                 so3_sampling_elmn2ind(&ind, el, m, n, parameters);
01671                 flmn[ind] = 0.0;
01672             }
01673 
01674     for (el = L0; el < L; ++el)
01675     {
01676         int eltmp;
01677 
01678         // Compute Wigner plane.
01679         switch (dl_method)
01680         {
01681         case SSHT_DL_RISBO:
01682             if (el != 0 && el == L0)
01683             {
01684                 for(eltmp = 0; eltmp <= L0; ++eltmp)
01685                     ssht_dl_beta_risbo_eighth_table(dl8, SO3_PION2, L,
01686                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED,
01687                         eltmp, sqrt_tbl, signs);
01688                 ssht_dl_beta_risbo_fill_eighth2quarter_table(dl,
01689                     dl8, L,
01690                     SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01691                     SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED,
01692                     el,
01693                     signs);
01694             }
01695             else
01696             {
01697                 ssht_dl_beta_risbo_eighth_table(dl8, SO3_PION2, L,
01698                     SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED,
01699                     el, sqrt_tbl, signs);
01700                 ssht_dl_beta_risbo_fill_eighth2quarter_table(dl,
01701                     dl8, L,
01702                     SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01703                     SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED,
01704                     el,
01705                     signs);
01706             }
01707             break;
01708 
01709         case SSHT_DL_TRAPANI:
01710             if (el != 0 && el == L0)
01711             {
01712                 for(eltmp = 0; eltmp <= L0; ++eltmp)
01713                     ssht_dl_halfpi_trapani_eighth_table(dl, L,
01714                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01715                         eltmp, sqrt_tbl);
01716                 ssht_dl_halfpi_trapani_fill_eighth2quarter_table(dl, L,
01717                     SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01718                     el, signs);
01719             }
01720             else
01721             {
01722                 ssht_dl_halfpi_trapani_eighth_table(dl, L,
01723                     SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01724                     el, sqrt_tbl);
01725                 ssht_dl_halfpi_trapani_fill_eighth2quarter_table(dl, L,
01726                     SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01727                     el, signs);
01728             }
01729             break;
01730 
01731         default:
01732             SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid dl method");
01733         }
01734 
01735         // Compute flmn for current el.
01736 
01737         switch (n_mode)
01738         {
01739         case SO3_N_MODE_ALL:
01740             n_start = MAX(-N+1,-el);
01741             n_stop  = MIN( N-1, el);
01742             n_inc = 1;
01743             break;
01744         case SO3_N_MODE_EVEN:
01745             n_start = MAX(-N+1,-el);
01746             n_start += (-n_start)%2;
01747             n_stop  = MIN( N-1, el);
01748             n_stop  -=  n_stop%2;
01749             n_inc = 2;
01750             break;
01751         case SO3_N_MODE_ODD:
01752             n_start = MAX(-N+1,-el);
01753             n_start += 1+n_start%2;
01754             n_stop  = MIN( N-1, el);
01755             n_stop  -= 1-n_stop%2;
01756             n_inc = 2;
01757             break;
01758         case SO3_N_MODE_MAXIMUM:
01759             if (el < N-1)
01760                 continue;
01761             n_start = -N+1;
01762             n_stop  =  N-1;
01763             n_inc = MAX(1,2*N-2);
01764             break;
01765         case SO3_N_MODE_L:
01766             if (el >= N)
01767                 continue;
01768             n_start = -el;
01769             n_stop  =  el;
01770             n_inc = MAX(1,2*el);
01771             break;
01772         default:
01773             SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid n-mode.");
01774         }
01775     
01776         // TODO: Pull out a few multiplications into precomputations
01777         // or split up loops to avoid conditionals to check signs.
01778         for (mm = -el; mm <= el; ++mm)
01779         {
01780             // These signs are needed for the symmetry relations of
01781             // Wigner symbols.
01782             double elmmsign = signs[el] * signs[abs(mm)];
01783 
01784             for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
01785             {
01786                 double mmsign = mm >= 0 ? 1.0 : signs[el] * signs[abs(n)];
01787                 double elnsign = n >= 0 ? 1.0 : elmmsign;
01788                  
01789                 // Factor which does not depend on m.
01790                 double elnmm_factor = mmsign * elnsign
01791                                       * dl[abs(n) + dl_offset + abs(mm)*dl_stride];
01792                 
01793                 for (m = -el; m <= el; ++m)
01794                 {
01795                     mmsign = mm >= 0 ? 1.0 : signs[el] * signs[abs(m)];
01796                     double elmsign = m >= 0 ? 1.0 : elmmsign;
01797                     int ind;
01798                     so3_sampling_elmn2ind(&ind, el, m, n, parameters);
01799                     int mod = ((m-n)%4 + 4)%4;
01800                     flmn[ind] += 
01801                         exps[mod]
01802                         * elnmm_factor
01803                         * mmsign * elmsign
01804                         * dl[abs(m) + dl_offset + abs(mm)*dl_stride]
01805                         * Gmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
01806                                mm + mm_offset + mm_stride*(
01807                                n + n_offset))];
01808 
01809                 }
01810             }
01811         }
01812     }
01813 
01814     free(dl);
01815     if (dl_method == SSHT_DL_RISBO)
01816         free(dl8);
01817     free(Fmnb);
01818     free(Fmnm);
01819     free(inout);
01820     free(w);
01821     free(wr);
01822     free(Fmnm_pad);
01823     free(Gmnm);
01824     free(sqrt_tbl);
01825     free(signs);
01826     free(exps);
01827     free(expsmm);
01828 
01829     if (verbosity > 0)
01830         printf("%sForward transform computed!\n", SO3_PROMPT);
01831 
01832 }
01833 
01850 void so3_core_inverse_direct_real(
01851     double *f, const complex double *flmn,
01852     const so3_parameters_t *parameters
01853 ) {
01854 
01855     int L0, L, N;
01856     so3_sampling_t sampling;
01857     so3_storage_t storage;
01858     so3_n_mode_t n_mode;
01859     ssht_dl_method_t dl_method;
01860     int steerable;
01861     int verbosity;
01862 
01863     L0 = parameters->L0;
01864     L = parameters->L;
01865     N = parameters->N;
01866     sampling = parameters->sampling_scheme;
01867     storage = parameters->storage;
01868     // TODO: Add optimisations for all n-modes.
01869     n_mode = parameters->n_mode;
01870     dl_method = parameters->dl_method;
01871     verbosity = parameters->verbosity;
01872     steerable = parameters->steerable;
01873 
01874     // Print messages depending on verbosity level.
01875     if (verbosity > 0)
01876     {
01877         printf("%sComputing inverse transform using MW sampling with\n", SO3_PROMPT);
01878         printf("%sparameters  (L, N, reality) = (%d, %d, FALSE)\n", SO3_PROMPT, L, N);
01879         if (verbosity > 1)
01880             printf("%sUsing routine so3_core_mw_inverse_direct with storage method %d...\n"
01881                     , SO3_PROMPT
01882                     , storage);
01883     }
01884 
01885     // Iterators
01886     int el, m, n, mm; // mm for m'
01887 
01888     // Allocate memory.
01889     double *sqrt_tbl = calloc(2*(L-1)+2, sizeof(*sqrt_tbl));
01890     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(sqrt_tbl);
01891     double *signs = calloc(L+1, sizeof(*signs));
01892     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(signs);
01893     complex double *exps = calloc(4, sizeof(*exps));
01894     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(exps);
01895   
01896     // Perform precomputations.
01897     for (el = 0; el <= 2*L-1; ++el)
01898         sqrt_tbl[el] = sqrt((double)el);
01899     for (m = 0; m <= L-1; m += 2)
01900     {
01901         signs[m]   =  1.0;
01902         signs[m+1] = -1.0;
01903     }
01904     int i;
01905     for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i)
01906         exps[i] = cexp(I*SO3_PION2*i);
01907 
01908     // Compute Fmnm'
01909     // TODO: Currently m is fastest-varying, then n, then m'.
01910     // Should this order be changed to m-m'-n?
01911     complex double *Fmnm = calloc((2*L-1)*(2*L-1)*N, sizeof(*Fmnm));
01912     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(Fmnm);
01913     int m_offset = L-1;
01914     int m_stride = 2*L-1;
01915     int n_offset = 0;
01916     int n_stride = N;
01917     int mm_offset = L-1;
01918     // unused: int mm_stride = 2*L-1;
01919 
01920     int n_start, n_stop, n_inc;
01921 
01922     double *dl = ssht_dl_calloc(L, SSHT_DL_QUARTER);
01923     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(dl);
01924     double *dl8 = NULL;
01925     if (dl_method == SSHT_DL_RISBO)
01926     {
01927         dl8 = ssht_dl_calloc(L, SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED);
01928         SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(dl8);
01929     }
01930     int dl_offset = ssht_dl_get_offset(L, SSHT_DL_QUARTER);
01931     int dl_stride = ssht_dl_get_stride(L, SSHT_DL_QUARTER);
01932 
01933     complex double *mn_factors = calloc((2*L-1)*N, sizeof *mn_factors);
01934     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(mn_factors);
01935 
01936     // TODO: SSHT starts this loop from MAX(L0, abs(spin)).
01937     // Can we use a similar optimisation? el can probably
01938     // be limited by n, but then we'd need to switch the
01939     // loop order, which means we'd have to recompute the
01940     // Wigner plane for each n. That seems wrong?
01941     for (el = L0; el <= L-1; ++el)
01942     {
01943         int eltmp;
01944         // Compute Wigner plane.
01945         switch (dl_method)
01946         {
01947         case SSHT_DL_RISBO:
01948             if (el != 0 && el == L0) 
01949             {
01950                 for(eltmp = 0; eltmp <= L0; ++eltmp)
01951                     ssht_dl_beta_risbo_eighth_table(
01952                             dl8, 
01953                             SO3_PION2, 
01954                             L,
01955                             SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED,
01956                             eltmp, 
01957                             sqrt_tbl, 
01958                             signs);
01959                 ssht_dl_beta_risbo_fill_eighth2quarter_table(dl,
01960                         dl8, L,
01961                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01962                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED,
01963                         el,
01964                         signs);
01965             } 
01966             else 
01967             {
01968                 ssht_dl_beta_risbo_eighth_table(
01969                         dl8, 
01970                         SO3_PION2, 
01971                         L,
01972                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED,
01973                         el, 
01974                         sqrt_tbl, 
01975                         signs);
01976                 ssht_dl_beta_risbo_fill_eighth2quarter_table(
01977                         dl,
01978                         dl8, L,
01979                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01980                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER_EXTENDED,
01981                         el,
01982                         signs);
01983             }
01984             break;
01985 
01986         case SSHT_DL_TRAPANI:
01987             if (el != 0 && el == L0) 
01988             {
01989                 for(eltmp = 0; eltmp <= L0; ++eltmp)
01990                     ssht_dl_halfpi_trapani_eighth_table(
01991                             dl, 
01992                             L,
01993                             SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
01994                             eltmp, 
01995                             sqrt_tbl);
01996                 ssht_dl_halfpi_trapani_fill_eighth2quarter_table(
01997                         dl, 
01998                         L,
01999                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
02000                         el, 
02001                         signs);
02002             }
02003             else
02004             {
02005                 ssht_dl_halfpi_trapani_eighth_table(
02006                         dl, 
02007                         L,
02008                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
02009                         el, 
02010                         sqrt_tbl);
02011                 ssht_dl_halfpi_trapani_fill_eighth2quarter_table(
02012                         dl, 
02013                         L,
02014                         SSHT_DL_QUARTER,
02015                         el, 
02016                         signs);
02017             }
02018             break;
02019 
02020         default:
02021             SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid dl method");
02022         }
02023 
02024         // Compute Fmnm' contribution for current el.
02025 
02026         // Factor which depends only on el.
02027         double elfactor = (2.0*el+1.0)/(8.0*SO3_PI*SO3_PI);
02028 
02029 
02030         switch (n_mode)
02031         {
02032         case SO3_N_MODE_ALL:
02033             n_start = 0;
02034             n_stop  = MIN( N-1, el);
02035             n_inc = 1;
02036             break;
02037         case SO3_N_MODE_EVEN:
02038             n_start = 0;
02039             n_stop  = MIN( N-1, el);
02040             n_stop  -=  n_stop%2;
02041             n_inc = 2;
02042             break;
02043         case SO3_N_MODE_ODD:
02044             n_start = 1;
02045             n_stop  = MIN( N-1, el);
02046             n_stop  -= 1-n_stop%2;
02047             n_inc = 2;
02048             break;
02049         case SO3_N_MODE_MAXIMUM:
02050             if (el < N-1)
02051                 continue;
02052             n_start = N-1;
02053             n_stop  = N-1;
02054             n_inc = 1;
02055             break;
02056         case SO3_N_MODE_L:
02057             if (el >= N)
02058                 continue;
02059             n_start = el;
02060             n_stop  = el;
02061             n_inc = 1;
02062             break;
02063         default:
02064             SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid n-mode.");
02065         }
02066 
02067         // Factors which do not depend on m'.
02068         for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
02069             for (m = -el; m <= el; ++m)
02070             {
02071                 int ind;
02072                 so3_sampling_elmn2ind_real(&ind, el, m, n, parameters);
02073                 int mod = ((n-m)%4 + 4)%4;
02074                 mn_factors[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
02075                            n + n_offset)] =
02076                     flmn[ind] * exps[mod];
02077             }
02078 
02079         for (mm = 0; mm <= el; ++mm)
02080         {
02081             // These signs are needed for the symmetry relations of
02082             // Wigner symbols.
02083             double elmmsign = signs[el] * signs[mm];
02084 
02085             for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
02086             {
02087                 // Factor which does not depend on m.
02088                 double elnmm_factor = elfactor
02089                                       * dl[n + dl_offset + mm*dl_stride];
02090                 for (m = -el; m < 0; ++m)
02091                     Fmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
02092                          n + n_offset + n_stride*(
02093                          mm + mm_offset))] +=
02094                         elnmm_factor 
02095                         * mn_factors[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
02096                                      n + n_offset)]
02097                         * elmmsign * dl[-m + dl_offset + mm*dl_stride];
02098                 for (m = 0; m <= el; ++m)
02099                     Fmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
02100                          n + n_offset + n_stride*(
02101                          mm + mm_offset))] +=
02102                         elnmm_factor 
02103                         * mn_factors[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
02104                                      n + n_offset)]
02105                         * dl[m + dl_offset + mm*dl_stride];
02106             }
02107         }
02108     }
02109 
02110     // Free dl memory.
02111     free(dl);
02112     if (dl_method == SSHT_DL_RISBO)
02113         free(dl8);
02114 
02115     switch (n_mode)
02116     {
02117     case SO3_N_MODE_ALL:
02118     case SO3_N_MODE_L:
02119         n_start = 0;
02120         n_stop  = N-1;
02121         n_inc = 1;
02122         break;
02123     case SO3_N_MODE_EVEN:
02124         n_start = 0;
02125         n_stop  = ((N-1) % 2 == 0) ?  N-1 :  N-2;
02126         n_inc = 2;
02127         break;
02128     case SO3_N_MODE_ODD:
02129         n_start = 1;
02130         n_stop  = ((N-1) % 2 != 0) ?  N-1 :  N-2;
02131         n_inc = 2;
02132         break;
02133     case SO3_N_MODE_MAXIMUM:
02134         n_start = N-1;
02135         n_stop  = N-1;
02136         n_inc = 1;
02137         break;
02138     default:
02139         SO3_ERROR_GENERIC("Invalid n-mode.");
02140     }
02141 
02142     // Use symmetry to compute Fmnm' for negative m'.
02143     for (mm = -L+1; mm < 0; ++mm)
02144         for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
02145             for (m = -L+1; m <= L-1; ++m)
02146                 Fmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
02147                      n + n_offset + n_stride*(
02148                      mm + mm_offset))] =
02149                     signs[abs(m+n)%2]
02150                     * Fmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
02151                            n + n_offset + n_stride*(
02152                            -mm + mm_offset))];
02153 
02154     // Apply phase modulation to account for sampling offset.
02155     for (mm = -L+1; mm <= L-1; ++mm)
02156     {
02157         complex double mmfactor = cexp(I*mm*SO3_PI/(2.0*L-1.0));
02158         for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
02159             for (m = -L+1; m <= L-1; ++m)
02160                 Fmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
02161                      n + n_offset + n_stride*(
02162                      mm + mm_offset))] *= mmfactor;
02163     }
02164 
02165     // Allocate space for shifted Fmnm'.
02166     complex double *Fmnm_shift = calloc((2*L-1)*(2*L-1)*N, sizeof(*Fmnm_shift));
02167     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(Fmnm_shift);
02168 
02169     // Allocate space for function values.
02170     double *fext = calloc((2*L-1)*(2*L-1)*(2*N-1), sizeof(*fext));
02171     SO3_ERROR_MEM_ALLOC_CHECK(fext);
02172 
02173     // Set up plan before initialising array.
02174     // The redundant dimension needs to be the last one.
02175     fftw_plan plan = fftw_plan_dft_c2r_3d(
02176                         2*L-1, 2*L-1, 2*N-1,
02177                         Fmnm_shift, fext,
02178                         FFTW_ESTIMATE);
02179 
02180     // Apply spatial shift.
02181     // This also reshapes the array to make n the inner dimension.
02182     for (mm = -L+1; mm <= L-1; ++mm)
02183     {
02184         int mm_shift = mm < 0 ? 2*L-1 : 0;
02185         for (n = n_start; n <= n_stop; n += n_inc)
02186         {
02187             for (m = -L+1; m <= L-1; ++m)
02188             {
02189                 int m_shift = m < 0 ? 2*L-1 : 0;
02190                 Fmnm_shift[n + n_stride*(
02191                            m + m_shift + m_stride*(
02192                            mm + mm_shift))] =
02193                     Fmnm[m + m_offset + m_stride*(
02194                          n + n_offset + n_stride*(
02195                          mm + mm_offset))];
02196             }
02197         }
02198     }
02199 
02200     // Free Fmnm' memory.
02201     free(Fmnm);
02202 
02203     // Perform 3D FFT.
02204     fftw_execute(plan);
02205     fftw_destroy_plan(plan);
02206 
02207     free(Fmnm_shift);
02208 
02209     // Extract f from the extended torus.
02210     // Again, we reshape the array in the process.
02211     int a,b,g;
02212     int a_stride = 2*L-1;
02213     // unused: int b_ext_stride = 2*L-1;
02214     int b_stride = L;
02215     int g_stride = 2*N-1;
02216     for (g = 0; g < 2*N-1; ++g)
02217         for (b = 0; b < L; ++b)
02218             for (a = 0; a < 2*L-1; ++a)
02219                 f[a + a_stride*(
02220                   b + b_stride*(
02221                   g))] = fext[g + g_stride*(
02222                               a + a_stride*(
02223                               b))];
02224 
02225     // Free fext memory.
02226     free(fext);
02227 
02228     if (verbosity > 0)
02229         printf("%sInverse transform computed!\n", SO3_PROMPT);
02230 
02231     // Free precomputation memory.
02232     free(sqrt_tbl);
02233     free(signs);
02234     free(exps);
02235     free(mn_factors);
02236 }
02237 
02255 void so3_core_forward_direct_real(
02256     complex double *flmn, const double *f,
02257     const so3_parameters_t *parameters
02258 ) {
02259     int L0, L, N;
02260     so3_sampling_t sampling;
02261     so3_storage_t storage;
02262     so3_n_mode_t n_mode;
02263     ssht_dl_method_t dl_method;
02264     int steerable;
02265     int verbosity;
02266 
02267     L0 = parameters->L0;
02268     L = parameters->L;
02269     N = parameters->N;
02270     sampling = parameters->sampling_scheme;
02271     storage = parameters->storage;
02272     // TODO: Add optimisations for all n-modes.
02273     n_mode = parameters->n_mode;
02274     dl_method = parameters->dl_method;
02275     verbosity = parameters->verbosity;
02276     steerable = parameters->steerable;
02277 
02278     // Print messages depending on verbosity level.
02279     if (verbosity > 0) {
02280         printf("%sComputing forward transform using MW sampling with\n", SO3_PROMPT);
02281         printf("%sparameters  (L, N, reality) = (%d, %d, FALSE)\n", SO3_PROMPT, L, N);
02282         if (verbosity > 1)
02283             printf("%sUsing routine so3_core_mw_forward_direct with storage method %d...\n"
02284                     , SO3_PROMPT
02285                     , storage);
02286     }
02287 
02288     int m_stride = 2*L-1;
02289     int m_offset = L-1;
02290     int n_offset = 0;
02291     int n_stride = N;
02292     int mm_stride = 2*L-1;
